DIRECTIONS
(Read all these directions carefully before
attempting to answer any question.)
1. This is a statement made under oath. Applicant's failure fully and accurately
to disclose any fact or information called for by any question may result in
the denial of the application for admission, or if applicant shall have been
admitted before the discovery thereof, in the revocation of his license to
practice law. 2. Answers must be in
black ink, in applicant's handwriting or typewriting, except as hereinafter
indicated. 3. Unless otherwise
indicated, every question and every part of each question must be answered, even though the answer be negative. 4. If the applicant cannot comply with any of
the requirements, he must state in detail the efforts he has made to comply and
why he cannot. Answers on information and belief will be accepted only in
connection with matters which the applicant cannot be expected to remember
because of extreme youth or other equally sufficient reason. All statements
made on information and belief must be so designated in the sworn statement, and the sources of information must be given. 5. Should the space left for any answer be
insufficient, the applicant shall complete his answer on a rider, specifying
the number of the question to which it relates, attached to this sworn
statement. Avoid riders whenever possible. 6. In stating addresses give street and
number, if any, city, village and state or country. If an address is in New

York City, give the borough in addition to the city. If present address of
applicant be in a village, give also the county. 7. In giving a period which is continuing at
the date of verification of this sworn statement, always give such period as
continuing "to date."

INSTRUCTIONS TO APPLICANTS FOR ADMISSION TO
THE BAR

GENERAL INSTRUCTIONS
(Applicable in All Judicial

Departments)

Strict compliance with these instructions is
required. Incomplete, defective or carelessly prepared papers will occasion
delay and may result in the rejection of the application. Any false statement contained in the
applicant's papers, or any failure to disclose any material fact, may result in
the denial of the application for admission; or if the applicant shall have
been admitted before the discovery thereof, in the revocation of his license to
practice law. Applicants should read carefully section
90
of the

Judiciary Law, Article 94 of the Civil Practice Law and Rules, and the Rules of
the Court of Appeals regarding the admission of attorneys and
counsellors-at-law. 1. OFFICIAL FORMS -- Applicants will be furnished the following standard forms: Questionnaire, Affidavits of Character, Affidavits of Legal Employment, and

College and Law School Certificates. 2. QUESTIONNAIRE -- Every applicant must file
a verified questionnaire, preferably typewritten, and must answer all questions
fully, truthfully and accurately. If the space provided be insufficient for a
complete answer, the answer may be given on a rider which should be signed by
the applicant, specifying by its number the question to which it relates. Avoid
use of riders, if possible. 3. AFFIDAVITS OF CHARACTER -- Every applicant must furnish affidavits of good
moral character from three reputable persons residing in the State of New York
in the same city or county in which the applicant resides or has resided for a
substantial period following his 18th birthday, one or whom preferably should
be an attorney in good standing in this State; or, if the applicant has resided
for a substantial period preceding the date of application, and following his
18th birthday, outside the State of New York, the required affidavits may be
furnished by persons residing in the community in which the applicant has so
resided. Do not submit affidavits of character from (a)
other applicants, (b) persons related to the applicant or (c) members of the
faculty or administrative staff of any law school which the applicant has
attended. 4. LEGAL EMPLOYMENT -- An
employer's affidavit is required concerning every employment of a legal nature
in a law office or legal department of a corporation or other business, or of a
legal aid or public office. 5. BUSINESS EMPLOYMENT -- If the applicant has not had any substantial legal
employment (No. 4, above), a letter addressed to the appropriate Committee on

Character and Fitness should be submitted on the letterhead of the applicant's
present employer, or if the applicant is not presently employed, from his last
employer, giving (a) the nature of the services rendered by the applicant, (b)
the period of employment, (c) the reason for leaving and (d) estimate of the
applicant's character. 6. COLLEGE
AND LAW SCHOOL CERTIFICATES -- A certificate must be submitted from each
college and law school attended by the applicant. The forms provided for that
purpose should be sent by the applicant to each such institution together with
a stamped envelope addressed to the appropriate filing office (indicated below)
of the Appellate Division to which the applicant has been certified by the

State Board of Law Examiners. 7. CERTIFICATE OF THE STATE BOARD OF LAW EXAMINERS -- Every applicant must file
with his application the certificate received by him from the State Board of

Law Examiners. 8. MATTERS REQUIRING
SPECIAL PROOF: A. Military Record -- Submit
copies of current classification card and each release and discharge from
military service, if any. B. Change
of Name -- If by court order, submit certified copy of order. Otherwise, submit
copy of birth certificate and affidavits by parents and applicant stating the
period of use of each name and that all names used are of the same person as
applicant. If by marriage, so state in questionnaire. C. Naturalization -- Applicant must exhibit, at the time of submitting his application papers, all naturalization papers
under which citizenship is claimed. D. Prior Admission in Other Jurisdictions --
Submit certificates of good standing from each court, Federal or State, to
which admitted, and a letter from each grievance committee, or other body
entertaining complaints against lawyers, certifying as to whether any charges
have been filed with such committee or body against the applicant, and, if so, setting forth the substance of the charges and the disposition
thereof. E. Divorce, Annulment or

Separation -- Submit a certified copy of the decree or judgment and a verified
statement of compliance with the directive portions of such decree or
judgment. F. Partnerships, Associations, etc., in Business or Profession -- If the applicant is or has
been engaged in any business or profess on with others in partnership, under a
corporate organization or otherwise, a letter should be submitted from at least
one of the applicant's associates covering the items listed under Business

Employment above (No. 5). 9. APPLICATION PAPERS -- Only fully completed
applications will be accepted for filing. Applications should be arranged in
the following order: a. Certificate of State

Board of Law Examiners. b. Questionnaire verified by applicant. c. Three affidavits of character. d. Affidavits of legal employment. e. Copy of current classification card and
each release and discharge from military service, if any. f. Any other papers applicant is required or
desires to submit. 10. FILING OFFICES -- Applications should be filed with, and all inquiries
concerning admission procedures directed to, the appropriate filing office
(indicated below) of the Appellate Division to which the applicant has been
certified by the State Board of Law Examiners. 11. Inability to comply with any of the
foregoing requirements for admission must be set forth in an affidavit of the
applicant indicating any omission and stating fully the efforts made by the
applicant to fulfill the requirements. Filing Offices
